name: simple_select
sql: SELECT * FROM users

name: select_with_where
sql: SELECT id, name FROM users WHERE active = true

name: inner_join
sql: SELECT u.id, u.name, o.order_id FROM users u INNER JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id

name: left_join
sql: SELECT u.id, u.name, COUNT(o.id) FROM users u LEFT JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id GROUP BY u.id, u.name

name: window_function_row_number
sql: SELECT name, salary, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY salary DESC) as rank FROM employees

name: window_function_partition
sql: SELECT dept, name, RANK() OVER (PARTITION BY dept ORDER BY salary DESC) as dept_rank FROM employees

name: cte_basic
sql: WITH active_users AS (SELECT id, name FROM users WHERE active = true) SELECT * FROM active_users

name: recursive_cte
sql: WITH RECURSIVE employee_hierarchy AS (SELECT id, name, manager_id FROM employees WHERE manager_id IS NULL UNION ALL SELECT e.id, e.name, e.manager_id FROM employees e JOIN employee_hierarchy eh ON e.manager_id = eh.id) SELECT * FROM employee_hierarchy
description: Recursive CTE - Parser limitation: RECURSIVE keyword not yet supported

name: subquery_in_select
sql: SELECT id, name, (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM orders WHERE user_id = users.id) as order_count FROM users
description: Subquery in SELECT clause - Parser limitation: scalar subqueries in SELECT list not yet supported

name: union_query
sql: SELECT name FROM employees UNION SELECT name FROM contractors

name: insert_basic
sql: INSERT INTO users (id, name, email) VALUES (1, 'John Doe', 'john@example.com')

name: update_basic
sql: UPDATE users SET name = 'Jane Doe' WHERE id = 1

name: delete_basic
sql: DELETE FROM users WHERE id = 1

name: case_expression
sql: SELECT name, CASE WHEN salary > 100000 THEN 'High' WHEN salary > 50000 THEN 'Medium' ELSE 'Low' END as salary_band FROM employees
description: CASE expression - Parser limitation: CASE expressions not yet supported

name: multiple_joins
sql: SELECT u.name, o.order_id, p.product_name FROM users u JOIN orders o ON u.id = o.user_id JOIN products p ON o.product_id = p.id

name: aggregate_functions
sql: SELECT COUNT(*), SUM(amount), AVG(amount), MIN(amount), MAX(amount) FROM transactions

name: having_clause
sql: SELECT department, COUNT(*) as emp_count FROM employees GROUP BY department HAVING COUNT(*) > 10

name: order_by_multiple
sql: SELECT name, salary FROM employees ORDER BY department ASC, salary DESC
description: ORDER BY multiple columns - Parser limitation: multiple ORDER BY columns not yet supported

name: limit_offset
sql: SELECT * FROM users LIMIT 10 OFFSET 20

name: in_clause
sql: SELECT * FROM users WHERE status IN ('active', 'pending', 'verified')
description: IN clause - Parser limitation: IN clause with value lists not yet supported
